text: I think you guys know about how much I
love ginger right well today I'm using
ginger in one of my favorite styles of
dish it's a one pot chicken and rice
dish but I'm making it sort of Asian so
it's ginger garlic and scallion as the
base I'm peeling my ginger I like to use
the edge of a spoon to peel ginger I
think it goes around the little knobby
pieces really nicely and remove skin
without removing much of the flesh of
the ginger so it's really great you'll
need two tablespoons of minced ginger
it's going to add tons of great flavor
fresh ginger not only adds great
fragrance and intensity it also gives a
little bit of spiciness that looks
pretty good on top of that four
scallions and I'll use the whole thing
the white part and the green now that
the aromatics are prepped you can start
your cooking off by browning your
chicken this is for skin on bone-in
chicken thighs season them with salt and
pepper both sides have a large straight
sided skillet heating the pan should be
oven proof because this is going to
start cooking on top of the stove but
you're going to finish it in the oven
add about two tablespoons of olive oil
to your pan and then the chicken goes in
skin side down to start browning
when the ticket is golden you can take
it out you don't need to brown the
second side and I'm just putting it back
on the plate that I had it on originally
because it's going to cook more so I'm
not worried about cross-contamination if
there's a ton of fat in the pan you can
pour some of it off but I have a mmm
like a couple tablespoons which is just
fine because I want to saute my
aromatics I'm going to add a couple
cloves of garlic and then scallions and
ginger you want to saute those add some
sliced shiitake mushrooms about 2 ounces
scrape up any brown bits if they stay
there stuck on the pan will get burnt
but they'll add tons of great flavor if
you get them before they burn and you
can add a little bit of your broth to
the pan to help that along there's
nothing Pleasant about eating burnt bits
but there's plenty great stuff to be
said about eating brown bits so cook
down your aromatics a little bit it's
starting to smell really fragrant the
mushrooms have softened now you can add
the rice one and a half cups of arborio
rice or another short grain rice arborio
works really well here stir till it's
coated in the fat and now you can add a
half a teaspoon of salt coarse salt and
a quarter teaspoon of a ground pepper
and then three and two thirds cups of
chicken broth I did add a little bit of
that broth already but you'll start with
a total of three and two thirds cups and
then what you want to do is bring this
to a boil before you return the chicken
to the pan liquids of boiling I've
preheated my oven to 375 degrees because
this is going to get transferred now to
the oven put the chicken back in the pot
skin side up cover it up and then cook
it until the chicken is cooked through
and the rice has absorbed all the liquid
will take about 25 minutes
doesn't that look great all of the
liquid has absorbed I'm ready to eat
some I don't know about you the rice is
nice and tender steamy hot mmm I tell
you what it smells like in here right
now so fantastic gingery fragrant I
accidentally put all my scallions and I
was supposed to save a few for the top
so I cut up a few more a little bit of
cilantro maybe and since you're not here
to try it I'll try it for you mmm
it's gingery garlicky fragrant Asian
chicken and rice you're going to love it
